notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.description: The notification system allows you to be automatically informed about important events - via email, webhook or in-app notification.

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: Under Notifications (accessible via the bell icon in the app bar) you will find three areas:
overview.inboxDesc: All your notifications with filter functions
overview.settingsDesc: Manage general settings and email addresses

eventTypes.title: Event Types
eventTypes.description: The following events can trigger notifications:
eventTypes.newDocumentDesc: A new document was found during crawling
eventTypes.documentRemovedDesc: A document is no longer available
eventTypes.crawlFailedDesc: A crawl job ended with errors
eventTypes.aiAnalysisCompletedDesc: The AI analysis of a document is finished
eventTypes.highConfidenceDesc: An AI result with high confidence was found
eventTypes.sourceStatusChangedDesc: The status of a data source has changed
eventTypes.sourceErrorDesc: There was an error with a data source

channels.title: Notification Channels
channels.emailDesc: Receive notifications via email. You can store multiple email addresses and select which addresses should be notified per rule.
channels.webhookDesc: Send notifications to an HTTP endpoint. Bearer token, API key and basic authentication are supported.
channels.inAppDesc: Notifications are displayed in the inbox. The bell icon shows the number of unread messages.

createRules.title: Create Rules
createRules.description: How to create a new notification rule:
createRules.step1Desc: Give a name and select the event type.
createRules.step2Desc: Select email, webhook or in-app as notification channel.
createRules.step3Desc: Restrict for which categories, sources or confidence values the rule should apply.
createRules.step4Desc: For email: Select recipients. For webhook: Provide URL and authentication.

filterOptions.title: Filter Options
filterOptions.categoriesDesc: Only notify for events in specific categories
filterOptions.dataSourcesDesc: Only notify for events from specific sources
filterOptions.minConfidenceDesc: Only for AI results above a threshold (0.0 - 1.0)
filterOptions.keywordsDesc: Only when specific terms appear in the document

digestMode.title: Digest Mode
digestMode.description: Instead of each individual notification, you can activate a digest:
digestMode.info: Digest Function: Collects multiple notifications and sends them bundled (hourly, daily or weekly). You can set the digest time in the settings.

emailAddresses.title: Manage Email Addresses
emailAddresses.description: Under Settings you can store additional email addresses:
emailAddresses.addDesc: Enter an email and optionally a label
emailAddresses.verifyDesc: New addresses must be verified via confirmation link
emailAddresses.deleteDesc: Remove addresses that are no longer needed

webhookConfig.title: Webhook Configuration
webhookConfig.description: For webhook notifications, the following authentication methods are supported:
webhookConfig.noneDesc: No authentication (only recommended for internal endpoints)
webhookConfig.warning: Test Webhook: Use the test function to check if your endpoint is reachable and responds correctly before activating the rule.

slashCommands.helpDesc: Show help, optionally for a specific topic
slashCommands.createDesc: Create new record (redirects to Smart Query)

examples.painPoints: Show all pain points in NRW

responseTypes.title: Response Types

tips.slashShortcuts: Use slash commands for quick actions

concept.title: Concept: Facet Types and Entity Types
concept.description: Facet types are assigned at the entity type level, not to individual entities. This means:
